instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3435: What is 820-3435? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP1V05_S0:
What is PP1V05_S0? The PP1V05_S0 power rail is for various components on the logic board that require a 1.05V supply voltage in the S0 (on) state. This voltage rail is likely to be used by the CPU (for VCCIO), PCH (Platform Controller Hub).

.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Fan spin, no cpuvcore
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B, corrosion damage to <CHIP>U7600</CHIP> area, <RESISTOR>R7630</RESISTOR> blown and replaced, computer now gets fan spin, however no cpu vcore, and pp1v05 is 0.4v, replaced <CHIP>U7600</CHIP>, checked <RESISTOR>R7611</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7612</RESISTOR>.
Replaced  <TRANSISTOR>Q7630</TRANSISTOR> and l7630. pp1v05 remains 0.4v.

I'm lost, have checked every component in the 1.05v s0 regulator circuit, feel like I'm missing something obvious.

<CHIP>U7600</CHIP>
<SIGNAL>P1V05S0_VTT</SIGNAL> - 0.800v
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL> - 0.429
<SIGNAL>P1V05S0_VTTREF</SIGNAL> - 0.750v
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0_VREF</SIGNAL> - 0.250v
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL> _fb- 0.160v
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0_VBST</SIGNAL> - 1.2v-1.8v

Where to next?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Fan spin, no cpuvcore
threads.message: Resistance to GND on 1V05? Diode mode and Ohm please. Voltage on pin 12/16/17?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Fan spin, no cpuvcore
threads.message:
200ohms to ground on <SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL> - 0.08v on diode mode

12 - 5.13v
16 - 3.32
17 - 0v

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Fan spin, no cpuvcore
threads.message: Check for corroded traces especially from <CHIP>U7600</CHIP> to <RESISTOR>R7630</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7630</RESISTOR> to <CAPACITOR>C7630</CAPACITOR>.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Fan spin, no cpuvcore
threads.message: Can mark as solved, was a corroded trace between <CHIP>U7600</CHIP> and <CAPACITOR>C7600</CAPACITOR>, thankyou
